meanings.definition: Feeling or showing anger or annoyance at what is perceived as unfair treatment.
meanings.sent1: She was very indignant when she found out she was not invited to the party.
meanings.sent2: The indignant customer demanded to speak to the manager about the poor service.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked indignant when it realized someone had eaten its food.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood indignant, its branches reaching out in protest against the harsh winds.
meanings.sent5: His indignant expression spoke volumes about his feelings of injustice.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or filled with indignation.
meanings.sent1: The indignant teacher scolded the students for not completing their homework.
meanings.sent2: She wrote an indignant letter to the editor expressing her disagreement with the article.
meanings.sent3: The indignant squirrel chattered angrily at the birds stealing its nuts.
meanings.sent4: The indignant storm clouds gathered, ready to unleash their fury on the town below.
meanings.sent5: His indignant tone echoed through the room, making everyone stop and listen.
